## Load recombination data files

```{r}
#-------------------------------------------------------------------
# Load data
#-------------------------------------------------------------------
ind <- c("MF1", "MF2", "MF3", "MF4", "MG2", "MG3", "MG4", "MG5", "NMF1", "NMF2", "NMF3", "NMF4", 
         "SI1", "SI2", "SI3", "SI4", "SS1", "SS2", "SS3", "SS4")
chr <- c("Chr1", "Chr2", "Chr3", "Chr4")

common_path = "~/sciebo/RecombinationLandscape_CRIP/01_Revison/Sorted_final_files/Final_Supplement/Zenodo/iSMC/"

# Chr1
files_to_read_1 = list.files(
  path = common_path,        # directory to search within
  pattern = "*Chr1_ismc.rho.10kb.bedgraph", # regex pattern, some explanation below
  recursive = TRUE,          # search subdirectories
  full.names = TRUE          # return the full path
)
data_lst_1 = lapply(files_to_read_1, read.table, header = TRUE)  # read all the matching files

# Chr2
files_to_read_2 = list.files(
  path = common_path,        # directory to search within
  pattern = "*Chr2_ismc.rho.10kb.bedgraph", # regex pattern, some explanation below
  recursive = TRUE,          # search subdirectories
  full.names = TRUE          # return the full path
)
data_lst_2 = lapply(files_to_read_2, read.table, header = TRUE)  # read all the matching files

# Chr3
files_to_read_3 = list.files(
  path = common_path,        # directory to search within
  pattern = "*Chr3_ismc.rho.10kb.bedgraph", # regex pattern, some explanation below
  recursive = TRUE,          # search subdirectories
  full.names = TRUE          # return the full path
)
data_lst_3 = lapply(files_to_read_3, read.table, header = TRUE)  # read all the matching files

# Chr4
files_to_read_4 = list.files(
  path = common_path,        # directory to search within
  pattern = "*Chr4_ismc.rho.10kb.bedgraph", # regex pattern, some explanation below
  recursive = TRUE,          # search subdirectories
  full.names = TRUE,          # return the full path
)
data_lst_4 = lapply(files_to_read_4, read.table, header = TRUE)  # read all the matching files

#-------------------------------------------------------------------
# Rename columns
#-------------------------------------------------------------------
# Rename data list names
names(data_lst_1) <- ind
names(data_lst_2) <- ind
names(data_lst_3) <- ind
names(data_lst_4) <- ind

# Check if renaming worked fine
#Make empty list, otherwise loop won't work
check_rename <- list()

for (i in 1:20){
  check_rename[i] <- identical(names(data_lst_1[i]), colnames(data_lst_1[[i]][4]))
}
check_rename


for (i in 1:20){
  check_rename[i] <- identical(names(data_lst_2[i]), colnames(data_lst_2[[i]][4]))
}
check_rename

for (i in 1:20){
  check_rename[i] <- identical(names(data_lst_3[i]), colnames(data_lst_3[[i]][4]))
}
check_rename

for (i in 1:20){
  check_rename[i] <- identical(names(data_lst_4[i]), colnames(data_lst_4[[i]][4]))
}
check_rename

# Rename columns in every data frame
# https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28648513/changing-column-names-in-a-list-of-data-frames-in-r
new_colnames <- c("chromosome", "start", "end", "rho")

data_lst_1 <- lapply(data_lst_1, rename_with, ~ new_colnames)
data_lst_2 <- lapply(data_lst_2, rename_with, ~ new_colnames)
data_lst_3 <- lapply(data_lst_3, rename_with, ~ new_colnames)
data_lst_4 <- lapply(data_lst_4, rename_with, ~ new_colnames)

# Change names in chromosome column to the correct chromosome
for (i in 1:20){
  data_lst_1[[i]][1] <- "Chr1"
}

for (i in 1:20){
  data_lst_2[[i]][1] <- "Chr2"
}

for (i in 1:20){
  data_lst_3[[i]][1] <- "Chr3"
}

for (i in 1:20){
  data_lst_4[[i]][1] <- "Chr4"
}

# Add column with individual name
for (i in 1:20){
  data_lst_1[[i]]$individual <- names(data_lst_1[i])
}

for (i in 1:20){
  data_lst_2[[i]]$individual <- names(data_lst_2[i])
}

for (i in 1:20){
  data_lst_3[[i]]$individual <- names(data_lst_3[i])
}

for (i in 1:20){
  data_lst_4[[i]]$individual <- names(data_lst_4[i])
}

# Merge dataframes into one big dataframe (df1 = chr1, df2 = chr2, ...)
df1 <- bind_rows(data_lst_1)
df2 <- bind_rows(data_lst_2)
df3 <- bind_rows(data_lst_3)
df4 <- bind_rows(data_lst_4)

df <-  rbind(df1,df2,df3,df4)

# Remove incomplete windows
df <- df %>%
  mutate(wnd_size = end-start)

unique(df$wnd_size) # window size should be only 10,000

window_size = 10e3

df <- df %>% 
  filter(wnd_size == window_size)

# also for the separate df
df1 <- df1 %>%
  mutate(wnd_size = end-start) %>% 
  filter(wnd_size == window_size)

df2 <- df2 %>%
  mutate(wnd_size = end-start) %>% 
  filter(wnd_size == window_size)

df3 <- df3 %>%
  mutate(wnd_size = end-start) %>% 
  filter(wnd_size == window_size)

df4 <- df4 %>%
  mutate(wnd_size = end-start) %>% 
  filter(wnd_size == window_size)

unique(df4$wnd_size)
```

## Define themes

```{r}
pop <-  c("MF", 
          "NMF", 
          "MG", 
          "SI", 
          "SS")

#my_palette <- c("#355BA4",
#                "#8f4e8a",
#                "#287f97",
#                 "#b26712",
#                "#AB3232")

my_palette <- c("#4C83EB",
                "#CD70C6",
                "#3AB6D8",
                "#FF941A",
                "#AB3232")

# Define theme
mytheme <- theme(axis.text.x = element_text(size = 14, color = "black"),
                 axis.text.y = element_text(size = 14, color = "black"),
                 axis.title.y = element_text(size = 14,face = "bold", color = "black"),
                 axis.title.x = element_text(size = 14,face = "bold", color = "black"),
                 title = element_text(size = 12, color = "black"),
                 panel.background = element_rect(fill="white"),
                 panel.grid.major = element_line("lightgrey"),
                 panel.grid.minor = element_line("white"),
                 panel.border = element_rect("black", fill = NA),
                 plot.background = element_rect(fill="white"),
                 legend.background = element_rect(fill="white"),
                 legend.position="bottom")
```

## Plot recombination maps

```{r}
# Chr1 with log10 transform
p1_mf <- mf_mean1 %>%
  ggplot(aes(y = mean_rho, x = start)) +  
  geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = SE.low,
                  ymax = SE.high),
              fill = my_palette[1],
              alpha = 0.5) +
  geom_line(size=0.5, colour = my_palette[1]) +
  scale_x_continuous(limits=c(0,last(df1$end)), labels = comma, expand = c(0.125,0.125)) +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(min(df3$rho), max(df4$rho)), trans="log10", labels = comma) +
  labs(x = "Position (bp)", y = ~rho, title = "MF population") +
  mytheme +
  guides(color = guide_legend(nrow = 1, byrow = TRUE)) +
  annotation_logticks(sides="l")
```

## Read in Cla-element data -\> Read in renamed files!

```{r}
# CLA-ELEMENT
##############################################
##    2. Read in Cla-element location file  ##
##        Population-wise annotation        ##
##############################################

# Bed file of extracted Cla-element locations extracted from RepeatMasker gff and now converted to csv-format
# Bed-file is composed of these columns (from https://bedops.readthedocs.io/en/latest/content/reference/file-management/conversion/rmsk2bed.html):

#  RepeatMasker annotation field |	BED column index 	| BED field
#---------------------------------------------------------------------
# Query sequence |	1 |	chromosome
# Query start |	2 |	start
# Query end |	3 |	stop
# Repeat name |	4  |	id
# Smith-Waterman score |	5 |	score
# Strand |	6 |	strand
# Percentage, substitutions |	7 	 
# Percentage, deleted bases |	8 	 
# Percentage, inserted bases |	9 	 
# Bases in query, past match |	10 	 
# Repeat class |	11 	 
# Bases in complement of the repeat consensus sequence |	12 	 
# Match start |	13 	 
# Match end |	14 	 
# Unique ID  |	15 	 
# Higher-scoring match (optional) |	16


Cla_colnames = c("chromosome", "start", "end", "repeatname")

# Read in csv file
files_to_read_5 = list.files(
  path = "~/sciebo/RecombinationLandscape_CRIP/01_Revison/Sorted_final_files/Final_Supplement/Zenodo/MELT-run2/Cla1/",        # directory to search within
  pattern = "*.bedgraph", # regex pattern, some explanation below
  recursive = TRUE,          # search subdirectories
  full.names = TRUE,          # return the full path
)


files_to_read_5

data_lst_5 = lapply(files_to_read_5, read.table, header = FALSE, na.string = "NA", sep = "\t", col.names = Cla_colnames)  # read all the matching files

# Convert to data frame
claAllPop <- bind_rows(data_lst_5[[1]])

claMF <- bind_rows(data_lst_5[[2]])

claMG <- bind_rows(data_lst_5[[3]])

claNMF <- bind_rows(data_lst_5[[4]])

claSI <- bind_rows(data_lst_5[[5]])

claSS <- bind_rows(data_lst_5[[6]])

# Get length and add population
claAllPop <- claAllPop %>% 
  mutate(length = end-start,
         pop = "AllPop")

claMF <- claMF %>% 
  mutate(length = end-start,
         pop = "MF")

claMG <- claMG %>% 
  mutate(length = end-start,
         pop = "MG")

claNMF <- claNMF %>% 
  mutate(length = end-start,
         pop = "NMF")

claSI <- claSI %>% 
  mutate(length = end-start,
         pop = "SI")

claSS <- claSS %>% 
  mutate(length = end-start,
         pop = "SS")


# Read in files with renamed inserts
# Read in csv file
files_to_read_6 = list.files(
  path = "~/sciebo/RecombinationLandscape_CRIP/01_Revison/Sorted_final_files/Final_Supplement/Zenodo/MELT-run2",        # directory to search within
  pattern = "*.combined.with.info.bed", # regex pattern, some explanation below
  recursive = TRUE,          # search subdirectories
  full.names = TRUE,          # return the full path
)


files_to_read_6

Cla_colnames = c("chromosome", "start", "end", "repeatname", "score", "strand", "indvidual")
data_lst_6 = lapply(files_to_read_6, read.table, header = FALSE, na.string = "NA", sep = " ", col.names = Cla_colnames)  # read all the matching files

# Convert to data frame
claMFr <- bind_rows(data_lst_6[[1]])

claMGr <- bind_rows(data_lst_6[[2]])

claNMFr <- bind_rows(data_lst_6[[3]])

claSIr <- bind_rows(data_lst_6[[4]])

claSSr <- bind_rows(data_lst_6[[5]])

# Get length and add population
claMFr <- claMFr %>% 
  mutate(length = end-start,
         pop = "MF")

claMGr <- claMGr %>% 
  mutate(length = end-start,
         pop = "MG")

claNMFr <- claNMFr %>% 
  mutate(length = end-start,
         pop = "NMF")

claSIr <- claSIr %>% 
  mutate(length = end-start,
         pop = "SI")

claSSr <- claSSr %>% 
  mutate(length = end-start,
         pop = "SS")

# Change region to match AllPop Melt analysis
# List of cla*r tables
cla_tables <- list(claMFr, claMGr, claNMFr, claSIr, claSSr)

# List of population names
populations <- c("MF", "MG", "NMF", "SI", "SS")

# Empty list to store the updated and merged tables
updated_merged_tables <- list()

# Loop through each table and population
for (i in seq_along(cla_tables)) {
  # Get the current table and population
  current_table <- cla_tables[[i]]
  pop_name <- populations[i]
  
  # Change region to match AllPop Melt analysis
  updated_table <- current_table %>%
    left_join(claAllPop %>% select(repeatname, start, end, length), by = "repeatname") %>%
    # Replace old start, end, and length values
    mutate(start = start.y, end = end.y, length = length.y) %>%
    # Select necessary columns
    select(chromosome, start, end, repeatname, score, strand, indvidual, length, pop)
  
  # Merge entries with the same repeatname, combining individuals
  merged_table <- updated_table %>%
    group_by(repeatname, chromosome, start, end, length, pop) %>%
    summarise(
      score = paste(score, collapse = ", "),       # Combine scores as a comma-separated string
      strand = paste(strand, collapse = ", "),     # Combine strands as a comma-separated string
      indvidual = paste(indvidual, collapse = ", "), # Combine individual names
      .groups = 'drop'
    )
  
  # Add the merged table to the list
  updated_merged_tables[[pop_name]] <- merged_table
}

# Access the final merged tables
claMFr_merged <- updated_merged_tables[["MF"]]
claMGr_merged <- updated_merged_tables[["MG"]]
claNMFr_merged <- updated_merged_tables[["NMF"]]
claSIr_merged <- updated_merged_tables[["SI"]]
claSSr_merged <- updated_merged_tables[["SS"]]

# View the final merged table for claSSr
head(claSSr_merged)
```

## Read in info about unique and shared insertions

```{r}
## Read in inserts
ins_sub <- read.csv("~/sciebo/RecombinationLandscape_CRIP/01_Revison/Sorted_final_files/Final_Supplement/Zenodo/input-files_figures/MELT_sharedsubsetins.csv", sep = ",", header = TRUE)

ins_all <- read.csv("~/sciebo/RecombinationLandscape_CRIP/01_Revison/Sorted_final_files/Final_Supplement/Zenodo/input-files_figures/MELT_sharedallins.csv", sep = ",", header = TRUE)

ins_uni <- read.csv("~/sciebo/RecombinationLandscape_CRIP/01_Revison/Sorted_final_files/Final_Supplement/Zenodo/input-files_figures/MELT_uniqueins.csv", sep = ",", header = TRUE)

ins_merged <- rbind(ins_sub, ins_all, ins_uni)


# Check if files are identical
# Assuming you have your ins_merged data frame ready
# Define a list of populations and their corresponding merged tables
populations <- list(
    MF = claMFr_merged,
    MG = claMGr_merged,
    NMF = claNMFr_merged,
    SI = claSIr_merged,
    SS = claSSr_merged
)

# Initialize a list to store results
results <- list()

# Loop through each population
for (pop in names(populations)) {
    # Filter ins_merged for the current population
    ins_filtered <- ins_merged %>%
      filter(grepl(paste0("\\b", pop, "\\b"), pops))  # Use \\b for whole word matching
    
    # Extract unique no_insert values for the filtered ins_merged
    unique_no_insert <- unique(ins_filtered$no_insert)
    
    # Compare with the respective cla*r_merged table
    cla_merged_table <- populations[[pop]]
    
    # Get the matching entries
    comparison_result <- cla_merged_table %>%
      filter(repeatname %in% unique_no_insert)
    
    # Check if all inserts from filtered ins_merged are present in the corresponding cla*r_merged table
    all_present <- all(unique_no_insert %in% cla_merged_table$repeatname)
    
    # Identify any inserts that are in unique_no_insert but not in the cla*r_merged table
    missing_in_cla <- setdiff(unique_no_insert, cla_merged_table$repeatname)
    
    # Store the results
    results[[pop]] <- list(
        comparison_result = comparison_result,
        all_present = all_present,
        missing_in_cla = missing_in_cla
    )
}

# View results for each population
for (pop in names(results)) {
    cat("Results for population:", pop, "\n")
    print(results[[pop]]$comparison_result)  # Display matching entries
    cat("All inserts present:", results[[pop]]$all_present, "\n")
    cat("Missing inserts in cla*r_merged:", results[[pop]]$missing_in_cla, "\n\n")
}

# ALL TRUE, NO INSERT IS MISSING

#----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Add a column specifying if it is unique or not'
# Example cla*r_merged data frames
# List of cla*r_merged dataframes with their respective population labels
cla_tables <- list(
  MF = claMFr_merged,
  MG = claMGr_merged,
  NMF = claNMFr_merged,
  SI = claSIr_merged,
  SS = claSSr_merged
)

# Loop through each table and add the Presence column based on ins_merged
for (pop in names(cla_tables)) {
  
  # Create a presence mapping based on ins_merged
  presence_mapping <- ins_merged %>%
    mutate(Presence = case_when(
      grepl(pop, pops) & !grepl(",", pops) ~ "Unique",  # Only this population is present
      grepl(pop, pops) & grepl(",", pops) ~ "Shared",  # This population is present with others
      TRUE ~ NA_character_  # Ensure NA for others
    )) %>%
    select(no_insert, Presence) %>%
    filter(!is.na(Presence))  # Keep only relevant presence data

  # Merge the Presence info into the respective cla*r_merged table
  cla_tables[[pop]] <- cla_tables[[pop]] %>%
    left_join(presence_mapping, by = c("repeatname" = "no_insert")) 
}

# Access the updated tables
claMFr_merged <- cla_tables$MF
claMGr_merged <- cla_tables$MG
claNMFr_merged <- cla_tables$NMF
claSIr_merged <- cla_tables$SI
claSSr_merged <- cla_tables$SS

# View the updated tables
print(head(claMFr_merged))

print(head(claMGr_merged))

print(head(claNMFr_merged))

print(head(claSIr_merged))

print(head(claSSr_merged))

# save table
us <- rbind(claMFr_merged, claMGr_merged, claNMFr_merged, claSIr_merged, claSSr_merged)

write.table(us, "complete_list_of_Cla_with_info_on_shared_and_unique.csv")
```
